channel.title: Runescape
channel.description:
I currently have 95 strength, what's the best (fastest) way to 99?
thanks.

JaydenD12:

I trained 90 - 99 str at giant spiders in security stronghold… Took 2 weeks…

There are better camping spots, i’m pretty sure the zombies in that varrock quest dungeon are about 70-100k xp p/h.

item.title: Runescape
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“Aeolian, post:19, topic:286886”]A lot of people are just going for the quickest way.

The best way about getting combat stats up is Slayer. Plain and simple. Even if you’re a pure you can supply your own food VIA fishing/cooking. On my old main account, I got 99 Attack, Strength, Defence and HP off of Slayer as well as making over 15+ Mil doing it.

If you want to do it the right way with profit. Go with slayer.

Otherwise be a wimpy fag who abuses ‘fun’ resources to cheaply gain experience.[/quote]

Only 15M? I am 85 slayer, and all I have gotten off of it is 96 attack, 99 strength(kind of, 95 actually), 96 hp, and 90 defence. I have made a lot more than 15m already, at least 25M + about 5m just from a few days at Abyssal Demons.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape
item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

A lot of people are just going for the quickest way.

The best way about getting combat stats up is Slayer. Plain and simple. Even if you’re a pure you can supply your own food VIA fishing/cooking. On my old main account, I got 99 Attack, Strength, Defence and HP off of Slayer as well as making over 15+ Mil doing it.

If you want to do it the right way with profit. Go with slayer.

Otherwise be a wimpy fag who abuses ‘fun’ resources to cheaply gain experience.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote="`Rich, post:15, topic:286886"][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=379406.msg2853524#msg2853524 date=1246689388]

If you want to get it the ‘real’ way, then train on npcs. If you want to be a gigantic faggot who can’t train skills the real way, then;

Soul Wars.

Also, http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,24.0.html

You can’t tell me you would sit there and kill dozens of thousands of NPCs when there is 21k xp a game at his level in Soul Wars(if you win, which is easy to determine the best team).
[/quote]

I would, the only time I’ve ever visited soul wars was to see what the fuck it was, it was boring as fuck, and only low levels use it anyway (usually new players, who don’t know about training years ago).

Pest control and Soul wars are completely gay, the only good thing about one, is that in pest control you can get armour rewards for the points (which is the only time i’d even think of about doing the minigame).

If niether one were added, there wouldn’t be anywhere near as many high levels then as there is now. Years ago you’d rarely see a level 120+, because training took so long, now you can easily get a 99 combat stat in a few weeks time (even without botting).[/quote]

Well, I guess it’s partly true. Soul Wars is boring, and I never used PC before for XP. Void range was the only reason I ever played it. I can’t say I haven’t trained on NPCs either, because getting 85 slayer got almost all of my combat skills over 90. The only time I used Soul Wars was for 95-99 strength, and I was dying to get out of there. PC is also boring, because there is no change in what you’re supposed to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:7, topic:286886”][quote author=`Rich link=topic=379406.msg2853281#msg2853281 date=1246669118]
If you want to get it the ‘real’ way, then train on npcs. If you want to be a gigantic faggot who can’t train skills the real way, then;

Soul Wars.

Also, http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,24.0.html

[/quote]

You can’t tell me you would sit there and kill dozens of thousands of NPCs when there is 21k xp a game at his level in Soul Wars(if you win, which is easy to determine the best team).[/quote]

I would, the only time I’ve ever visited soul wars was to see what the fuck it was, it was boring as fuck, and only low levels use it anyway (usually new players, who don’t know about training years ago).

Pest control and Soul wars are completely gay, the only good thing about one, is that in pest control you can get armour rewards for the points (which is the only time i’d even think of about doing the minigame).

If niether one were added, there wouldn’t be anywhere near as many high levels then as there is now. Years ago you’d rarely see a level 120+, because training took so long, now you can easily get a 99 combat stat in a few weeks time (even without botting).

Read full topic
